segment.source: Exercise 2 - Identify Problems with Missing Drivers
segment.target: Exercise 2 - Identify Problems with Missing Drivers

segment.source: A tight integration between drivers, devices, Windows, and the firmware is required to ensure proper power management and a high rate of DRIPS residency.
segment.target: A tight integration between drivers, devices, Windows, and the firmware is required to ensure proper power management and a high rate of DRIPS residency.

segment.source: Exercise 2 - Identify Problems with Missing Drivers
segment.target: Exercise 2 - Identify Problems with Missing Drivers

segment.source: A tight integration between drivers, devices, Windows, and the firmware is required to ensure proper power management and a high rate of DRIPS residency.
segment.target: A tight integration between drivers, devices, Windows, and the firmware is required to ensure proper power management and a high rate of DRIPS residency.

segment.source: If a device is missing a driver or doesn’t have the right driver, it can impact the associated device power management and resulting D-state.
segment.target: If a device is missing a driver or doesn’t have the right driver, it can impact the associated device power management and resulting D-state.

segment.source: Download the pre-generated sleepstudy-report2.html report here.
segment.target: Download the pre-generated sleepstudy-report2.html report here.

segment.source: Open sleepstudy-report2.html with your favorite browser.
segment.target: Open sleepstudy-report2.html with your favorite browser.

segment.source: The system consumes 4.585 Watts of energy during 11 minutes and the DRIPS % is 0.
segment.target: The system consumes 4.585 Watts of energy during 11 minutes and the DRIPS % is 0.

segment.source: Look at the Top Offenders table.
segment.target: Look at the Top Offenders table.

segment.source: An Unregistered Device is listed as active 100% of the time during the session.
segment.target: An Unregistered Device is listed as active 100% of the time during the session.

segment.source: The unregistered device is the graphics adapter (GFX) as specified by the device name SB.PCI0.GFX0.
segment.target: The unregistered device is the graphics adapter (GFX) as specified by the device name SB.PCI0.GFX0.

segment.source: When an Unregistered Device is present in the top offenders list, it means that the ACPI firmware has defined it, but Windows doesn’t have it on its list of power managed devices.
segment.target: When an Unregistered Device is present in the top offenders list, it means that the ACPI firmware has defined it, but Windows doesn’t have it on its list of power managed devices.

segment.source: This could mean one of two things:
segment.target: This could mean one of two things:

segment.source: One device is missing a driver.
segment.target: One device is missing a driver.

segment.source: An ACPI firmware constraint was defined for a device not present in the system.
segment.target: An ACPI firmware constraint was defined for a device not present in the system.

segment.source: In this example, the system didn’t have a proper driver installed for the Display Adapter, as shown below in the Device Manager.
segment.target: In this example, the system didn’t have a proper driver installed for the Display Adapter, as shown below in the Device Manager.
